is_discharging.description: Check if battery is discharging (i.e. in use).

percent.description: Return percentage charge of battery in [0, 100].

minutes_to_empty.description: Minutes of battery life left (may be empty if not known yet).

minutes_to_full.description: Minutes until the battery is charged (may be 0 if full, or empty if not on charge or not known).

capacity.description: Battery's current capacity in mWh (mAh on macOS).

design_capacity.description: Battery's original capacity in mWh (mAh on macOS).

macos.is_discharging: pmset -g batt | head -n1 | grep -qv "'Battery Power'"; echo $?
macos.is_charging: pmset -g batt | grep InternalBattery | grep -qv '; charging'; echo $?
macos.percent: pmset -g batt | grep InternalBattery | grep -Eo '\d+%'| grep -Eo '\d+'
macos.minutes_to_empty: pmset -g batt | grep discharging | grep -Eo '\d+:\d+' | awk '{S=($1*60)+$2}END{print S}' FS=:
macos.minutes_to_full: pmset -g batt | grep ' charg' | grep -Eo '\d+:\d+' | awk '{S=($1*60)+$2}END{print S}' FS=:

linux.is_discharging: upower -d | grep state | head -n1 | grep -qv 'discharging'; echo $?
linux.is_charging: upower -d | grep state | head -n1 | grep -qv ' charging'; echo $?
linux.minutes_to_empty: upower -d | grep 'time to empty' | head -n1 | grep hours | grep -Eo '[0-9\.]+ .' | awk '{print int($1 * ($2=="m"?1:60))}'
linux.minutes_to_full: upower -d | grep 'time to full' | head -n1 | grep hours | grep -Eo '[0-9\.]+ .' | awk '{print int($1 * ($2=="m"?1:60))}'
